title.narrative: ENHANCED GOUVERNMENT CAPACITY

description.narrative: Government capacity for health and nutrition coordination, planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation is enhanced., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children and women, especially the most vulnerable and hard-to-reach, utilise more quality essential health and nutrition services and benefit from positive health and nutrition care practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government capacity for health and nutrition coordination, planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation is enhanced.

description.narrative: Major results achieved in 2019 included: the development of key strategic plans for immunization, multi-sectoral plan for nutrition, a new CMAM protocol to boost the capacity of the MOH to deliver quality services and a harmonised approach for nutrition, immunization, reproductive health and PMTCT programmes. Supervision was improved in 241 health facilities and 18 districts thanks to procurement of vehicles. Besides, one national survey was supported on food security and nutrition. UNICEF also worked with WHO and other partners to boost preparedness and response to epidemics such as Ebola, Cholera and Malaria. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of provinces with functional multisectoral coordination mechanisms with UNICEF support

Child sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to public health emergencies are in place
Existance of a free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirments
